notes: base clitic; also locative/reflexive; becomes "ce" before lo/la/li/le/ne
example_sentence_english: We will see each other tomorrow.
Will you give us a hand?

notes: marks first person plural reflexive or reciprocal; used with reflexive verbs
example_sentence_english: We will talk to each other tomorrow.

notes: locative; also about it or in it with certain verbs like credere and tenere
variant of "ci" used before another clitic (e.g., lo/la/li/le/ne)
example_sentence_english: Will you give it to us?

notes: used in set phrases like "ce la caviamo"
pleonastic with "avere" in "ce l'ho"; also emphatic/colloquial
